name: lime production, hydrated, loose weight | lime, hydrated, loose weight | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5337/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of hydrated lime. The infrastructure data is estimated based on a tour and sketches of the process, and normalized with a annual production capacity of about 20'000 tons of product per year. There are no significant dust emissions as a dust control system is installed. ;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From the reception of quicklime at the factory gate.

This activity ends with the hydrated lime produced. The dataset includes the different production processes (slaking, crushing, dust abatement (cyclone), transportation and storing), the total heating energy for "production" and "administration", and the infrastructure.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data is based on a Swiss company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data is based on the Swiss current technology. The company KFN works on a technically high level. Effective dust control systems are installed.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: data which are only available for RER have been used as proxy for CH

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Hydrated lime is produced by reacting quicklime with water; it consists mainly of calcium hydroxide. In general, hydrated lime refers to a dry calcium hydroxide powder. Hydrated lime is widely used in aqueous systems as a low-cost alkali.
